monounsaturated %: (oleic acid - omega 9) C18:1. mostly oleic acid & erucic acid
other fat %: difference between sat, mono, poly sum and fat total
omega 6 to omega 3 ratio: using calc: X to 1. typical hunter-gatherer diet: 1:1. typical Western diet : 15:1-16.7:1. ideal dietary ratio 4:1 or less.
omega 3 %: mostly alpha linolenic acid, C18:3. consumption of 3 related to positive health benefits. essential during pregnancy
omega 6 %: mostly linoleic acid, C18:2; high consumption linked to negative health effects
note: dark brown - best for searing, browning & deep frying. light brown - best for baking, oven cooking and stir frying. yellow - best for light saute, sauces and low-heat baking. light yellow - don't heat - best for dressing & dips
source names: Other sources listed on supplementary sheets
omega 6 : omega 3 ratio (old): typical hunter-gatherer diet: 1:1. typical Western diet : 15:1-16.7:1. ideal dietary ratio 4:1 or less.
